title: Hebrew - sort of - help please
content:
I apologize for the poor quality graphic. I know this is a reasonably common font; thanks for the help on this, typophiles.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003424im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Salmo_3608.jpg)

 [‹ Any ideas? "st" ligature](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003424/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43871 "Go to previous forum topic") [I need help identifying a font... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003424/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43864 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jrgott

comments.content:
I assume you are asking about the Latin letters. I think those look like one of Hans Eduard Meier’s calligraphic fonts, such as [Barbedor](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/barbedor/) or [Syndor](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/syndor/). I’m having trouble seeing your image details well enough, but I lean towards Barbedor.

- Mike Yanega
I suspect that the Hebrew was drawn, as to me it looks a bit crude.

Frank Ruehl (or New Peninim — if you have mac)

(Originally and before the crude period as Bill said)
